name: Conrad Indianapolis

reviews.text: Escape in the city of Indianapolis at Spa Chakra at the Conrad! First class spa with first class staff, products, fitness area and pool. No need to travel out west or Chicago seeking the ultimate spa treatments or therapies. I highly recommend the 90 minute massage, 2 hour hydrating body wrap with vichy shower, and a facial! Top off your day spa experience with an overnight at the Conrad. In-room dining had limited food options but the bed was amazing with fluffly pillows, comforters and cool 400 count sheets. They do need cd players in the room. I could have had a room on a higher floor. I was on the 14th floor with a limited city view. I brought my own dvd's and watched movies, ordered room-service and drank wine during my escape. Breakfast in-room was delicious and fast the next morning. Valet parking was great and the bell man helped me manuever out onto the busy street and on my way the next morning. Also note, the hotel is right across the street from the mall and in close proximity to many restuarants. The Capital Grill is right in the hotel and has great steaks!
reviews.title: Spa Chakra @ Conrad....GREAT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's frankly amazing that Indianapolis has a hotel of this quality. Everything was top notch. Spacious rooms, luxurious bed, stylish furnishings, great shower, large HDTV, super service. The only thing I could possibly find to quibble about would be the street noise, but that is probably more the fault of Indy's above average number of muffler-less motorcycles. I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else.
reviews.title: Just fantastic
Best hotel facility I have ever stayed in, service was wanting
reviews.text: As far as facilities go, this hotel was the nicest I have ever used. The service was a bit wanting. Although the staff was very nice, the restaurant had several people waiting to be seated with several tables still needing to be bussed. Also, we did not receive what we ordered for breakfast when we used room service on one occasion. Other than these two things, the stay was great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very impressive but very expensive. We really enjoyed dinner, and the bar. I did get a massage at the hotel, and i enjoyed every second. Overall the trip and hotel was very relaxing and laidback. The staff is very attentive.
reviews.title: Very Expensive

likes.disliked: — Had the use the room key everytime you wanted to use the elevator. Good for security but i always forgot my key

reviews.text: This Conrad leaves much to be desired. The Conrad in Chicago is excellent and I expected the same here. The front desk staff needs a lot of work. It was like pulling teeth trying to get them to order a car for me for the morning of departure. The when I tried to check out, there was no one around. The Chicago location uses L'Occitane en Provence bath products, which is a really nice touch for $500/night. I suppose this location uses something else because the rooms are less expensive. On the surface it looks nice, but aving stayed in hotels that are better staffed, I was quite disappointed in this place.
reviews.title: Not on par with with the price

reviews.text: I'm familiar with the Conrad chain (Hilton's high end) from traveling in Asia, but had never seen nor stayed in one in the US.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at the Conrad

reviews.text: Overall, I had an excellent experience and doubt any other hotel in Indy can come close.

reviews.text: Stayed there for a work conference & FFA was in town. Hotels were hard to find, but I feel I found one of the best in town. Hotel is awesome from all aspects. Staff was so helpful-had to ship something home & they we're more than anxious to help. Great location in downtown Indianapolis-close to many restaurants. Room was CLEAN! Big screen TV on Wall & TV in the bathroom! Bedding was luxurious as well. Excellent Property! Highly recommended!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: Stayed here for the Big 10 championship game. Great downtown location. Staff was helpful even with the crowds. Great that you can use the enclosed walkway to get around. Don't need a coat in the winter! Pool is gorgeous. Capitol Grille in the lobby is a must for breakfast
reviews.title: We'll be back!!

reviews.text: Needing a vacation, but no time to travel - I checked in at the Conrad Indianapolis. Checking in, Leland was wonderful in making me feel welcome and appreciated as a guest. Location is great to walk anywhere downtown, but with Tastings, the wine bar and Capital Grille on the first floor - there is no need to go anywhere else. My room was clean, spacious and the bathroom was great.
reviews.title: relaxing and elegant

reviews.text: Loved using the fitness room ( they have everything), the indoor pool and the steamroom in the women's locker room on the 6th floor. It was a wonderful getaway, without the long travel. Every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful, they always ask if there is anything you need. Loved it, can't wait to go again!
reviews.title: NICE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved my stay, enjoyed every moment (except for the shooting outside, got to love Indy), nice comfy bathrobes and slippers, nice deep jacuzzi tub with tv in bathroom. The bathroom scale needs to be thrown away. Loved the Keurig coffeemaker. Liked being on a private floor.
reviews.title: Center City Convienience

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Conrad several times for business, and it is consistently excellent. The rooms are very comfortable, the staff is helpful, and the location is the best in downtown Indianapolis. Easy walk to the Circle (including the monument and Hilbert Circle Theater), IRT, and many restaurants and stores. Relatively short walk to Eiteljorg, NCAA and Indiana State Museum as well as Victory Field. There are other fine, more affordable hotels in the area, but if you can afford it (or someone else is paying!), the Conrad is well worth it!
reviews.title: Excellent location, great service, good for business

reviews.text: Right in the middle of downtown Indianapolis and close to restaurants, mall, stadium. This property is a high end hotel. The hotel open its doors less than 5 years ago. Everything is new and upgraded, Staff is helpful.
reviews.title: Good location and great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love this hotel. I even enjoy the snootiness of the front desk associates, it’s strangely fitting. I’ve stayed at this hotel several times over the past few years. The location is excellent for downtown shopping (even though Nordstrom’s has closed), sporting events, and fine dining. If you do have a chance to stay here, please try the Evan Todd salon. The salon staff is wonderful and it’s a modern yet relaxing atmosphere. I love the shampoo chairs. The pool is fantastic and the fitness center is certainly better than the average hotel fitness center.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience, Best Hotel in Indy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are fantastic and the beds are amazing! I really enjoy the tea service they offer for an extra charge at night. The bathroom shower and tub are great…I really can’t say enough about how much I enjoy staying at this hotel.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: I have had a few minor things happen over the years. Turndown service is not consistent. It used to be offered all the time and now I don’t typically receive it at all. As a Hilton HHonors Diamond member I expect those types of perks on a regular basis, but it’s my understanding that all rooms receive nightly turn down service and I haven’t had turn down service for the past several stays…and I’m usually out at dinner until well after 10 p.m. I've had a few minor bleeps, TV in bathroom doesn't work, bathroom tub not properly cleaned, but these are things that frequent travelers sometimes encounter.
reviews.title: great conference hotel in Indianapolis

reviews.text: I loved the Conrad - the service, room, location and amenities are amazing. Sunday brunch is the best thing I've ever seen! I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience luxury.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: Great staff, smaller but clean rooms.

reviews.text: It was my 30th wedding anniversary, and since my husband had a discount at his Firm, we chose to stay at the Four Star Conrad in Indianapolis. The room was clean and terrifically decorated and equipped; the marble bathroom was “die for” but after an engineer came up to fix our television, every time the occupants of the next room slammed their heavy room door, the TV flicked off. At 10:00 p.m. we retired for the evening. Around 11:40 PM, I was awakened by the loud party next to our room. Their door would open, someone would shriek like a banshee, music would boom out, and lots of loud voices and laughter could be heard. I’d fall back to sleep. Then, another guest would show up, same thing. The coup de grace was when a loud male voice announced (in a non-smoking hotel -- 17th Floor that is) that he needed a lighter to light his cigarette. I stumbled to the phone and called the front desk (Conrad Services). The obsequious voice at the other end said he would send Security, which he did. The Security man talked to the twenty-something young woman who registered the room; she had 8 or more people partying with her as guests. As soon as Security left, same thing. My husband woke up and went to the phone and complained. Security came up again; told the party next to us to be quiet. As soon as he would leave, the noise would start again. After the second visit from Security, the music next door was no longer audible, but the talking and laughing and shouting got all the louder. My husband swears he also heard noise coming from another party a couple of rooms to the left of our room. For all we know, there could have been people moving between the parties in the two rooms. There was an outer security door in the hallway, separating our room and the room to the right (containing most of the party noise) from the rest of the guest rooms on our west end of the 17th floor. One of the partygoers decided to shut that security door (which needed a guest room pass card or a key to open), so we were essentially locked in with this going on next to our room. Each time Security came up, the security man would unlock that security door and prop it back open, and 5 or 10 minutes later, one of the partyers would shut it again. One of the guests came out, shouting, “I’m leaving. Give me your elevator pass card.” My husband called the front desk again. He said the noise was intolerable. More people arrived looking for the party; my husband, standing at the door’s peephole in his undershorts, saw two of them. A thirtyish man in a black suit, holding the necks of two bottles of champagne in one hand, was loudly looking for the party. On the fourth call, the man at Conrad Security assures us that the party was being moved to the 2nd floor (Why they did not do this to begin with is a mystery). As the party left, my husband counted ten people walking out, one carrying a chest-size cooler and another one a boom box. The front desk was checking their room inventory because he said there was no guarantee that there wouldn’t be loud noise when these people returned to their room. My husband hung up. So, at about 1:15 A.M., as we were getting ready to pack up and possibly check out and drive 76 miles home, the phone rang. It was the front desk. We were told that a bellman was coming right up to move us to a different room, on a different floor. Of course, the bellman could not reach our room because the partygoers had shut that security door again on their way out. Do you know what it is like to repack your belongings to go to a different room in the middle of the night? For this nightmare, our stay was free of charge, and we were given two breakfast vouchers worth twenty dollars for the Capital Grille. And, mind you, a breakfast including two eggs over easy cost fourteen dollars, and a 3-egg omelet was $12 or $13. For a top hotel like the Conrad, a reputation for incomparable customer service is the most important asset. We were grateful to be “comped” for the room instead of being charged, but why did it take 4 calls and more than 90 minutes to reach a solution to this party noise problem? To sum up, a four- or five-star hotel doesn’t mean you are not going to be put in a room next to folks with total lack of manners and respect for others. I think a Motel 6 or Red Roof Inn would have been better. At least, I could have called the Police. P.S. When I needed coffee, the coffee machine in the second room didn't work.
reviews.title: Do Not Plan Your Meeting Here!!!!

reviews.text: Excellent location, room exceptionally clean and exactly as described, with ample desk and work area, as well as large seating with couch, chairs and coffee table in the "deluxe king" room. With a large soaking tub and well placed flat screen TV for viewing while soaking, along with a large walk-in shower, the bathroom was one of the nicest I've experienced (rivaled so far only by the bathroom in the Raffles hotel in Singapore!). We ordered one dinner and two breakfasts from room service, and delivery was within 30-40 minutes, hot and delicious. Front desk and concierge were both very helpful and friendly. Spent the afternoon at the Evan Todd Spa, where Jeff worked wonders with a relaxing aromatherapy massage, and Kelly renewed my horribly dry skin with a fantastic moisturizing facial. My daughter also had her hair shampooed and styled at the hair salon, and loved her look and the pampering as well. Every inch of this hotel is impeccably decorated, and we loved the short connecting walkway to Circle Center Mall. We didn't use the pool, but did check it out, and the families with little ones were clearly loving it! Will highly recommend to anyone traveling to Indianapolis, and hope to return soon!
reviews.title: Oasis of Luxury for Mother-Daughter Weekend!

reviews.text: I was here back in November. In spite of it being a busy weekend in Indy, (Cheerleading competition), they upgraded me to a corner suite. 4 tvs! 2 baths , a large bedroom with a large sitting room. I was in town with my 9 year old for a swim meet. Because of the hotel, it was actually a relaxing weekend. The service here is phenomenal
reviews.title: Back again, and even better

description: Welcome to the Conrad Indianapolis Luxury Hotel.The Conrad Indianapolis hotel in downtown Indianapolis is a destination that connects you with an innovative guest experience unmatched by other Indianapolis hotels. Located at the most prominent intersection in Indianapolis, a skybridge provides an uninterrupted path from our Indianapolis luxury hotel's ballroom and meeting rooms to the Artsgarden, Circle Centre Mall and the Indiana Convention Center. Our 23-story tower boasts 241 guest rooms, 15,000 square feet of state-of-the-art meeting space, a rejuvenating wellness center with a state-of-the-art fitness centre and pool, and two entrancing restaurants. Fine dining options at our luxury hotel in Indianapolis include The Capital Grille, with outstanding culinary delights served in an intimate dining experience, and Tastings, a wine bar experience that uses progressive wine technology for guests to enjoy wines by the taste, glass or bottle.
